rooms.name: Tricky Stair
rooms.text: While traversing the grand staircase, you imperceptibly notice a nail sticking out of one of the antique floorboards.

rooms.name: What the hell just happened?
rooms.text: Stepping on the Nail because you didn’t think you’d feel it through 4 inch platform heels your foot catches and, miraculously, you trip at a 90 degree angle to the 3rd dimension and find yourself in the kitchen of a respectable middle class rural suburban household. It smells of fresh coffee, and there’s a half eaten scone on the counter. The kitchen door is open to the outside and you can see a park across the street.

rooms.name: A breath of fresh air
rooms.text: The sun shines bright and birds singing in the trees. Couples are strolling in the park together with blankets and picnic baskets. A slight breeze brings scents of cherry blossoms. Their pink petals float in the breeze and line the sidewalks. You see a rusted gate at the end of the street that looks familiar.

rooms.name: A Lovely Day
rooms.text: As you stroll through the park an older man with the most adorable brown puppy and an ice cream cone passes by. He smiles at you friendlily. ‘Great day for a double dip,’ he says, motioning to the ice cream cart up the path. You remember that you appear to find yourself in an alternate reality and wonder if you should try to find your way back.

rooms.name: Off the beaten path
rooms.text: This is the fanciest ice cream cart you've found in years. You get a giant scoop of strawberry ice cream in a waffle cone and drizzled with a (frankly, obscenely expensive) balsamic vinegar. The kindly woman running the cart smiles at you, and winks when returning your change. You notice the quarter’s faces here have Mary Ellen Pleasant on them instead of George Washington. Anyway, you see a path that leads off into the woods and you hear the sounds of a guitar strumming, perhaps flutes, coming from the wooded path.
